amendment.description: Amendment sought to authorize the Secretary of Homeland Security to provide indemnification to the manufacturers of anti-terrorism products.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 22 and printed in House Report 107-615 to indemnify companies who sell anti-terrorism technologies to the federal government, as well as, state and local governments, in a manner similar to the protection afforded under P.L.85-804.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Turner amendment (A022) Failed by recorded vote: 214 - 215 (Roll no. 359).
